Subject: Sensitive Data False Positives
Description:
Can you use wildcards for the Sensitive Data False Positives? For example UNC:
\pcnamefolder1*.txt or \pcnamefolder1data*.txt?
What_We_Know__c:
Adding False Positive Exclusion Filters

https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/EnterpriseAuditor/Admin/Settings/SensitiveData/Exclusions/Add.htm

NEA v11.6 - False Positives Tab
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/EnterpriseAuditor/Admin/Settings/SensitiveData/Exclusions/Overview.htm

My internal testing indicates that wildcards should work as you have indicated.  With the current configuration, you need to set the false positive (Settings > Sensitive Data > False Positives) prior to running the full FileSystem collection and collecting them.

Can you use wildcards for the Sensitive Data False Positives? 
For example UNC:
\pcnamefolder1*.txt or \pcnamefolder1data*.txt?
Solution_Comment__c:
+++++

+++++
My internal testing indicates that wildcards should work as you have indicated.  With the current configuration, you need to set the false positive (Settings > Sensitive Data > False Positives) prior to running the full FileSystem collection and collecting them.
